item.title: MidJourney-List
item.description:
MidJourney List

  • 2023-MidJourney Styles and Keywords Reference: A reference containing Styles and Keywords that you can use with MidJourney AI. There are also pages showing resolution comparison, image weights, and much more!

item.title: Object-Detection-List
item.description:
Object Detection List

  • Move Your Cursor with Webcam Using TensorFlow Object Detection API: TensorMouse is a small open source Python application that allows you to move your cursor by moving a random household object (like a cup, apple or banana) in front of webcam and acts as a replacement for computer mouse or trackpad.

  • 2018-Deep Dive into Object Detection with Open Images, using TensorFlow: TensorFlowâ€™s Object Detection API and its ability to handle large volumes of data make it a perfect choice, so letâ€™s jump right inâ€¦

item.title: OCR-List
item.description:
OCR List

  • LEADTOOLs

  • SwiftOCR: Fast and simple OCR library written in Swift

  • The Best Online OCR Software for Converting Images to Text

  • NewOCR

  • OnlineOCR

  • Ocrad: is an OCR (Optical Character Recognition) program based on a feature extraction method. It reads images in pbm (bitmap), pgm (greyscale) or ppm (color) formats and produces text in byte (8-bit) or UTF-8 formats.

Overview

  • OCR-Benchmark

  • awesome-ocr: A curated list of promising OCR resources.

Engineering Practices

  • 2018-Dropbox-Using machine learning to index text from billions of images: So now, when a user searches for English text that appears in one of these files, it will show up in the search results. This blog post describes how we built this feature.

Case Study

Resource

item.title: OpenCV-List
item.description:
OpenCV List

  • 2015-LearnOpenCV #Book#: This repo contains code for Computer Vision, Deep learning, and AI articles shared on our blog LearnOpenCV.com.

item.title: StableDiffusion-List
item.description:
StableDiffusion List

  • Hugging Face Diffusion Models Course ðŸŽ¥: Materials for the Hugging Face Diffusion Models Course.

OpenSource

  • Diffusion Bee : Diffusion Bee is the easiest way to run Stable Diffusion locally on your M1 Mac. Comes with a one-click installer. No dependencies or technical knowledge needed.

  • Stable Diffusion WebUI Docker : Run Stable Diffusion on your machine with a nice UI without any hassle! This repository provides multiple UIs for you to play around with stable diffusion.

  • CHARL-E : CHARL-E packages Stable Diffusion into a simple app. No complex setup, dependencies, or internet required â€” just download and say what you want to see.

  • UnstableFusion : A Stable Diffusion desktop frontend with inpainting, img2img and more!

  • stablediffusion-infinity : Outpainting with Stable Diffusion on an infinite canvas.

  • Diffusion Bee : Diffusion Bee is the easiest way to run Stable Diffusion locally on your M1 Mac. Comes with a one-click installer. No dependencies or technical knowledge needed.

  • InvokeAI : This version of Stable Diffusion features a slick WebGUI, an interactive command-line script that combines text2img and img2img functionality in a “dream bot” style interface, and multiple features and other enhancements. For more info, see the website link below.

  • MDM: Human Motion Diffusion Model : The official PyTorch implementation of the paper “Human Motion Diffusion Model”.

  • stable-diffusion-studio : An animation focused workflow frontend for Stable Diffusion.

  • novelai-colab-ver : You can use this version to experience how novelai works without a good gpu.

  • fast-stable-diffusion : fast-stable-diffusion colabs, +25-50% speed increase + memory efficient + DreamBooth

  • 2023-civitai : Our goal with this project is to create a platform where people can share their stable diffusion models (textual inversions, hypernetworks, aesthetic gradients, VAEs, and any other crazy stuff people do to customize their AI generations), collaborate with others to improve them, and learn from each other’s work. The platform allows users to create an account, upload their models, and browse models that have been shared by others. Users can also leave comments and feedback on each other’s models to facilitate collaboration and knowledge sharing.

Showcase

  • 2023-Stable-diffusion-person : æœ¬æ–‡ä»‹ç»ç”±åŸºäºŽ Stable-diffusion çš„ Chilloutmix æ¨¡åž‹ï¼ˆä»¥åŠæœ€æ–°çš„ ControlNetï¼‰ç”Ÿæˆé«˜æ¸…çœŸå®žäººåƒçš„æ–¹æ³•åŠ Demoã€‚

  • 2023-scribble-diffusion : Turn your rough sketch into a refined image using AI.

  • 2023-stable-diffusion-webui-colab : stable diffusion webui colab.

GUI & APP

  • 2022-Gauss : A Stable Diffusion app for macOS built with SwiftUI and Apple’s ml-stable-diffusion CoreML models.

  • 2023-ComfyUI : A powerful and modular stable diffusion GUI with a graph/nodes interface.

  • 2023-Web Stable Diffusion : Bringing stable diffusion models to web browsers. Everything runs inside the browser with no server support.
